clinical_study.brief_title: PROTECT-ASUC: Covid-19 Pandemic Response Of assessmenT, EndosCopy and Treatment in Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: PROTECT-ASUC: Covid-19 Pandemic Response Of assessmenT, EndosCopy and Treatment in Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis: A Multi-centre Observational Case- Control Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

clinical_study.source: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

brief_summary.textblock: Whether the perceived changes in management of Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis during the COVID pandemic are widespread, and whether they have any impact on patient outcomes

detailed_description.textblock: The study aims to evaluate the process, evaluation and therapy variation in management of ASUC with reference to 2019 British Society of Gastroenterology guidelines and see whether there are any differences between ambulatory and hospital management in ASUC. Also to evaluate the outcomes in ASUC patients managed during the COVID-19 pandemic

primary_outcome.measure: Primary outcome measure: The need for in-hospital colectomy or rescue therapy
primary_outcome.description: The need for in-hospital colectomy or rescue therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: 2.1: Duration and type/route of steroid use
secondary_outcome.description: Duration and type/route of steroid use

arm_group.description: Patient with Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis based on Modified Truelove and Witts Severity Index managed during the study period
Patients with ASUC managed in the unit from 1st Jan to 31st June 2019

study_pop.textblock: In The UK alone approximately 6500 patients are admitted with ASUC each year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 16 -100 inclusive
- Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis based on Modified Truelove and Witts Severity Index managed during the study period
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 16 -100 inclusive
- Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis based on Modified Truelove and Witts Severity Index managed during the study period
- Admission for elective colectomy
- Pouch or stoma
